title: Barrett Reviews 1000xRESIST

transcript_chunks.text: Barrett you played a THX resist tell me all about it uh a THX resist is a game out now on Steam and switch uh it's the deut game from Sunset visitor a vancouver-based Dev and it's published by fellow traveler known for publishing other games like citizen sleeper uh it's a science fiction narrative focused walking Sim with a near automa aesthetic and before your eyes glaze over and you're like Barrett I'm not really into walking Sims narrative heavy games uh I will give the context that these game these types of games are not really games that I really uh draw myself to either with that said um I think it is a 9.5 amazing game uh that everybody should at least check out for this year uh the one big kind of mechanic outside of just kind of walking around and getting story stuff is that you are jumping between point and time to relive the memories of a person who is seemingly the sole survivor of a world ending event um you play as Watcher and you live in a colony full uh fully made up of

jumping between point and time to relive the memories of a person who is seemingly the sole survivor of a world ending event um you play as Watcher and you live in a colony full uh fully made up of clones that are all cloned after this one person and you all kind of live to serve her and she uh she is called the all mother uh this Colony has called her the game opens up with you literally stabbing the allm mother in the back and then it's kind of Off to the Races on like what's the context here how did we get to this moment and kind of learning the backstory of of Watcher and what led her to commit this kind of crime right um for me the reason that it is an amazing game it is the the story is I honestly think is one of the most creative I've seen in the game the story itself but then also the way the story unfolds it's not afraid to kind of weave several stories together at the same time and have it all kind of emotionally unfold before you uh if you enjoy nonlinear kind of

then also the way the story unfolds it's not afraid to kind of weave several stories together at the same time and have it all kind of emotionally unfold before you uh if you enjoy nonlinear kind of Storytelling that we've seen a lot in like Chris n uh Christopher Nolan films I think you'd get a lot out of this if you enjoyed just like really interesting science fiction uh amongst the kind of like arival and like Moon I think you'd get a lot out of this I I know that the Aesthetics are very like uh anime uh near kind of heavy but I think the the way the story is told uh has a much more like western style to it uh which I think is a an interesting ju supposition and the the story and the writing itself uh is kind of really really strong and how they're able to balance so many uh spinning plates on what this game is tackling um a lot of the kind of big emotional things uh revolve around like what lessons we carry from our parents and like how does that affect Us's parents and how that

plates on what this game is tackling um a lot of the kind of big emotional things uh revolve around like what lessons we carry from our parents and like how does that affect Us's parents and how that could affect our families for generations to come it tackles uh what Justice Means to us and like why it's important to fight for something no matter how futile it feels it also brings in uh real world advents to kind of help commentate on these things like the Hong Kong protests that started a few years back uh it brings in you know the very recent big thing of like the pandemic um and it's also kind of just all-encompassing what it means to be human constantly facing an uncertain future um and those are just kind of a few examples of what this game is all about I think if this was a lesser game I think all of these topics trying to be talked about at the same time could have come off a little bit like heavy-handed but I just I think the strength of the writing and the delicate unfolding

I think all of these topics trying to be talked about at the same time could have come off a little bit like heavy-handed but I just I think the strength of the writing and the delicate unfolding of the story makes tackling all of these subject matters like seem really easy which is not definitely not an easy thing to do um I personally think it is the best story I've experienced in a game so far this year uh if you care about inventive storytelling and you care about new themes and topics being in explored in video games uh I think you owe it to yourself to play a THX resist okay awesome it's on my list now for sure hell yeah
